movesets.name: Bulky Attacker

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

Drain Punch is the key move on the set, letting Mienfoo KO several notable threats in the metagame, such as Pawniard and Tirtouga. Knock Off is an amazing move, taking items from opponents and hitting Ghost- and Psychic-type threats like Slowpoke for solid damage. U-turn preserves momentum, lets Mienfoo get out of a bad situation, and activates Regenerator. Fake Out helps Mienfoo do chip damage and can be used to break Sturdy. However, only use Fake Out when the chip damage is necessary, as the move is predictable and can offer free switch-ins to your opponent. Taunt prevents setup, keeps opponents from crippling Mienfoo with status, blocks recovery, and is especially useful with Mienfoo's decent Speed. High Jump Kick is an option for greater attacking power, but losing Drain Punch reduces Mienfoo's longevity.

Set Details

In this set, Speed is maximized and bulk is optimized, enhancing Mienfoo's ability to deal with Pawniard. Without the Speed investment, standard Pawniard outspeeds and KOes with a +2 Iron Head, even if Mienfoo has maximum bulk. If you aren't particularly concerned about Pawniard, a spread of 156 HP / 116 Def / 196 SpD with an Impish nature maximizes bulk, but if Mienfoo is running Taunt, this is not advised. Eviolite is chosen to enhance Mienfoo's bulk and Regenerator provides extra healing.

Usage Tips

This set is geared towards bulky offense and balanced teams, either as glue or part of a VoltTurn core. It should be used as a pivot, tanking resisted hits and hitting something with Knock Off, KOing with Drain Punch if necessary, and switching out with U-turn. If your opponent has something faster that threatens Mienfoo, such as Abra, it should not use U-turn, but should instead switch out manually. This set excels early- to mid-game, where it can target key threats and either cripple or eliminate them.

Team Options

Mienfoo works well as part of a VoltTurn core. Chinchou can beat Flying-types while also helping with Slowpoke. Magnemite can do this as well, but but it trades bulk for the ability to beat the Fairy-types that wall Mienfoo. Vullaby and Larvesta can beat Foongus and Croagunk and also have U-turn. A Regenerator core can be formed alongside Slowpoke and Foongus, creating a highly durable trio that can spread status and Knock Off items to weaken foes, softening the opposing team for a late-game sweep. Foongus beats Spritzee, Slowpoke beats Fletchling, and Mienfoo beats bulky special walls that block the other two. Other Fighting-types, as well as Dwebble and Tirtouga, appreciate Mienfoo's ability to use Knock Off on walls such as Slowpoke and Spritzee.

movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

High Jump Kick is Mienfoo's STAB move here as well as its primary revenge killing move. Don't spam it if your opponent still has a Ghost-type, as you run the risk of Mienfoo losing half of its health. Knock Off goes well with a Choice Scarf set, as it can surprise Pokemon that would normally be faster than Mienfoo and helps clear out Ghost-types. Drain Punch should be used when you don't want to risk a High Jump Kick miss and need to revenge kill something. U-turn should be used on predicted switches, and is particularly helpful because it activates Regenerator. Stone Edge is also an option for hitting Larvesta, giving it utility over Drain Punch.

Set Details

The EVs are standard for an offensive Pokemon, maximizing Attack and Speed, and an Adamant nature is chosen as with a Choice Scarf, Mienfoo still hits 24 Speed. The remaining EVs are placed in Special Defense for extra special bulk, though moving them to HP or Defense is fine now that there is no need to survive Misdreavus's Dazzling Gleam. Choice Scarf helps Mienfoo to revenge kill and clean, and Regenerator is the best of Mienfoo's abilities.

Usage Tips

This set should spam Knock Off and U-turn early game, using Mienfoo's STAB to revenge kill when needed. High Jump Kick is powerful enough to clean up late-game once all Pokemon that resist or are immune to it have been removed. This set fits best on an fast offensive team, where the utility given by the Eviolite set is not needed.

Team Options

This set works best on a VoltTurn team, and appreciates partners such as Magnemite, Chinchou, and Archen, which can help to beat Flying-types. Larvesta and Vullaby are also appreciated, as they can beat threats such as Foongus and Croagunk. Pursuit Pawniard is a really good teammate, easily removing Ghost-types and so allowing Mienfoo to clean up late-game. Late-game sweepers, such as Tirtouga, appreciate Mienfoo's Knock Off support.

movesets.name: Life Orb

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

High Jump Kick is the primary move and wallbreaking tool on this set. Knock Off punishes Ghost-types and can help to wallbreak and weaken Mienfoo's checks and counters. U-turn preserves momentum and activates Regenerator to help mitigate Life Orb recoil. Fake Out provides general priority and chip damage. Mienfoo can use it if your team is especially weak to Sturdy Pokemon such as Dwebble or Tirtouga, although this is better done by the bulky attacker set. If you do include Fake Out, make sure not to give your opponents free switch-in opportunities, and although the chip damage is nice, the Life Orb recoil can add up. Stone Edge can be used to hit Larvesta, which otherwise walls Mienfoo and can burn it with Flame Body. It also hits Ponyta on the switch without risking a burn, but should only be done when it is in KO range. Poison Jab gives Mienfoo the ability to 2HKO Spritzee if it has already lost its item to Knock Off.

Set Details

The EV spread is standard for an offensive Pokemon, with full investment in Attack and Speed to maximize damage output and offensive potential. Life Orb is the key item of the set, emphasizing Mienfoo's wallbreaking capabilities, and its recoil can be mitigated through Regenerator.

Usage Tips

This set is best off used as a hit-and-run attacker on bulky offense or offensive teams that need a longer-lasting wallbreaker and don't require the bulk of the main set. It is a little tougher to play with as it can't really take hits and is hard to switch in due to its frailty. This set isn't nearly as reliable against Pawniard, as it is beaten by a combination of Knock Off and Sucker Punch if it's at +2, and Iron Head flat out OHKOes Mienfoo on the switch. Nonetheless, the power of this set is immense, and the strength the Knock Off + U-turn is further amplified by Life Orb. Mienfoo can even manage to KO a full-health Slowpoke with this combination. This set works well early- to mid-game to weaken your opponent's team by smashing opposing Pokemon with High Jump Kick and Knock Off.

Team Options

This set works best on VoltTurn teams thanks to the greater ease of switching in. It appreciates teammates such as Larvesta and Vullaby, which can beat Croagunk and Foongus for it. Checks for Flying-types, such as Chinchou and Archen, are also appreciated. Late-game sweepers such as Scraggy and Tirtouga also appreciate the wallbreaking and Knock Off support.

moves.name: Acrobatics
moves.description: Doubles in power if user has no held item.

moves.name: Aerial Ace
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Ally Switch
moves.description: Switches position with another Pokemon on user's side of the field.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Aura Sphere
moves.description: Ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Baton Pass
moves.description: User switches, but passes on all stat changes and some special conditions.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Calm Mind
moves.description: Boosts Special Attack and Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Detect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in 1 turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Drain Punch
moves.description: Leeches 50% damage.

moves.name: Dual Chop
moves.description: Hits 2 times in one turn.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fake Out
moves.description: The user always moves first, and flinches the foe. Can only be used on the first turn out.

moves.name: Feint
moves.description: Only works if the foe uses Detect or Protect; nullifies effects of those moves.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Force Palm
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.description: Increases power of ally's moves by 50%.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: High Jump Kick
moves.description: If it misses, user loses HP equal to 1/2 the damage that would have been dealt.

moves.name: Jump Kick
moves.description: If it misses, user loses HP equal to 1/2 the damage that would have been dealt.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Low Kick
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Low Sweep
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Me First
moves.description: Uses the foe's attack at 1.5x power. Must be faster to work.

moves.name: Meditate
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Poison Jab
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Pound
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psych Up
moves.description: Copies the foe's stat changes.

moves.name: Quick Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from priority attacks.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Reflect
moves.description: Lowers damage from physical attacks for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Reversal
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Role Play
moves.description: Copies the foe's ability and overwrites the user's ability.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Smelling Salts
moves.description: Has 120 power on a paralyzed target, but cures it of paralysis.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Swift
moves.description: Always hits.

moves.name: Swords Dance
moves.description: Boosts Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Vital Throw
moves.description: Moves second, but ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Reckless
abilities.description: Increases the power of recoil moves by 20%.

abilities.name: Regenerator
abilities.description: Wielder heals 1/3 of its maximum HP on switching out.
